com.glmapview

Class GLMapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.SurfaceView
        • com.glmapview.GLMapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, android.view.TextureView.SurfaceTextureListener

    public class GLMapView
extends android.view.SurfaceView
implements android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, android.view.TextureView.SurfaceTextureListener
    GLMapView is a custom SurfaceView that renders and presents vector map

      • convertDisplayDeltaToInternal

        public MapPoint convertDisplayDeltaToInternal(MapPoint val)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Converts a distance between two points on the screen to delta in internal format of GLMapView.

        Surface must exist when calling this function

        Parameters:
        val - The point with the delta
        Returns:
        The same object that was passed to method call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        See Also:
        convertDisplayToInternal(MapPoint), doWhenSurfaceCreated(Runnable)

      • convertDisplayDeltaToInternal

        public MapPoint convertDisplayDeltaToInternal(MapPoint val,
                                              double mapZoom,
                                              double mapAngle)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Converts a distance between two points on the screen to delta in internal format of GLMapView.

        Surface must exist when calling this function

        Parameters:
        val - The point with the delta
        mapZoom - Zoom to use for calculations
        mapAngle - Angle to use for calculations
        Returns:
        The same object that was passed to method call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        See Also:
        convertDisplayToInternal(MapPoint), doWhenSurfaceCreated(Runnable)

      • convertDisplayToInternal

        public MapPoint convertDisplayToInternal(MapPoint val)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Converts a point on the surface to an internal map coordinate.

        Surface must exist when calling this function

        MapPoint pt = mapView.convertDisplayToInternal(new MapPoint(touchX, touchY));

        Parameters:
        val - The point on surface to be converted
        Returns:
        The same object that was passed to method call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        See Also:
        convertInternalToDisplay(MapPoint), doWhenSurfaceCreated(Runnable)

      • convertInternalToDisplay

        public MapPoint convertInternalToDisplay(MapPoint val)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Converts a point in internal format of GLMapView to point on the surface of view.

        Surface must exist when calling this function

        MapPoint pt = mapView.convertInternalToDisplay(new MapPoint(internalPoint));

        Parameters:
        val - The point to be converted
        Returns:
        The same object that was passed to method call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        See Also:
        convertDisplayToInternal(MapPoint), doWhenSurfaceCreated(Runnable)

      • doWhenSurfaceCreated

        public void doWhenSurfaceCreated(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Runs command on internal rendering thread. If surface does not exists at this moment command will be executed when it will be created. 
        
     final GLMapView mapView = (GLMapView) this.findViewById(R.id.map_view);
     mapView.doWhenSurfaceCreated(new Runnable() {
        public void run() {
            mapView.setMapCenter(center, false);
            mapView.scaleMap(scaleChange, null, false);
        }
     });
        Parameters:
        r - The Runnable to be executed at internal theread when surface will be created

      • loadStyle

                      java.lang.String path)
        Loads map style. mapView.loadStyle(getAssets(), "DefaultStyle.bundle");
        Parameters:
        assetManager - The AssetManager to be used while loading resources
        path - Path to folder in assets that contains Style.mapcss and images

      • setUserInteractionEnabled

        public void setUserInteractionEnabled(boolean userInteractionEnabled)
        If map do not need to handle touches set userInteractionEnabled to false. By default userInteractionEnabled is true.
        Parameters:
        userInteractionEnabled - false will disable handling user touches to move map

      • setRasterTileSources

        By default rasterTileSources is nil. In this case GLMapView will use vector sources that was added or downloaded by GLMapManager.
        Parameters:
        tileSources - Raster tile sources to use

        mapWidth - width of visible area

        Returns:
        Returns origin point of the map coordinate system.

      • setMapOrigin

        public void setMapOrigin(MapPoint point)
        Origin point of the map coordinate system (X, Y). Changing the values in this property between 0 and 1 in relative coordinates describes the point of GLMapView which is considered as a center point for `mapCenter` and `setMapCenter:animated:`.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to be filled with values.

                          double duration,
                          int animation)

        animation - animation to use.
